keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, with the final beating in the infirmary resulting in his death.
The body-camera footage, which is silent but shows guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, played a central role in the prosecution's case and sparked national outrage.

David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though Kieffer was charged with false instrument filing and both faced second-degree gang assault charges.
The prosecution argues that all guards acted as a gang, showing a depraved indifference to human life, and that the violence was collective and intentional.
Brooks, serving a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault since 2017, was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility, where he was attacked while in handcuffs.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing several officers in civil lawsuits.

Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025, death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, indicating a broader pattern of misconduct across New York's correctional system.
Six of the 10 guards indicted in February were charged with murder, with five pleading guilty to manslaughter and one to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with evidence.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two who testified at trial.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, died after being brutally beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, with the fatal beating captured on silent body-camera footage. David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges. The prosecution argued that all guards acted as a gang, showing a depraved indifference to human life. The case, led by special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself, revealed systemic issues in prison enforcement. The incident is part of a broader pattern of violence, with a similar fatal beating of Messiah Nantwi occurring at Mid-State Correctional Facility in March 2025. Multiple guards have pleaded guilty to lesser charges, and others are scheduled for trial, indicating an ongoing effort to hold correctional officers accountable for misconduct.
